answers.answer: I am not familiar with how medications are dispensed in Peru. Best to talk with your doctor and/or a knowledgeable Pharmacist about drug interactions with your diabetes medication/s. For detailed drug information you can ask for a copy of the pharmacology and/or pharmaceutical paperwork that accompanies each drug, or Google search drug name followed by pharmacology and/or pharmaceutical and look for a PDF form.

question: is it correct to use atacand if you are a  diabetic (II) person?which is better to control blood pressure?( enalapril or atacand)which has less side effects?(enalapril or atacand)
title: diabetes ,atacand and enalapril
